decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): C33105-100 Existing Ground Floor Plans; C33105-101 Existing First Floor Plans; C33105-102 Existing Elevations; C33105-103 Proposed Ground & First Floor Plans; C33105-104 Rev A Proposed 2nd Floor and Roof Plan; C33105-105 Rev A Proposed Elevations; C33105-106 Site Plan; C33105-107 Location & Block Plan; C33105-108 Proposed Front Elevation & Streetscene; C33105-109 Proposed Rear Elevation Vertical 45 Degree Line; 4299 Shadow Study Issue No. 2 prepared by T16 Design prepared by February 2022.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): C33105-100 Existing Ground Floor Plans; C33105-101 Existing First Floor Plans; C33105-102 Existing Elevations; C33105-103 Proposed Ground & First Floor Plans; C33105-104 Rev A Proposed 2nd Floor and Roof Plan; C33105-105 Rev A Proposed Elevations; C33105-106 Site Plan; C33105-107 Location & Block Plan; C33105-108 Proposed Front Elevation & Streetscene; C33105-109 Proposed Rear Elevation Vertical 45 Degree Line.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, Cycle storage for four (4) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site (as per the proposed site plan), within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage has been provided, as indicated on the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2), in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The private garden amenity area shown on the approved plan ref: C33105-107 shall be laid out and demarcated prior to first occupation the unit hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The 2no. car parking space shown on the approved plan ref: C33105-106 shall be laid out prior to the first occupation of the units hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction. The car parking space shall only be used by the residents of the development hereby permitted.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | No part of the flat roofs of the proposed dwellinghouses shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The window/s inserted in the side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The hard and soft landscaping shall be provided, in accordance with drawing C33105-106, prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouses other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be assessed with regard to the Council's standard in the SPG10 and noise limits of BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal room- and external amenity noise levels shall be mitigated as necessary to achieve noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation in the dwellings of a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air. The details to be submitted shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system.  The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site are not adversely affected by air pollution, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies GG3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Conversion of the existing property into two self-contained residential units; alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension and installation of three roof lights to front roof slope; single storey, part two storey side/rear/front extensions; two front porch extensions; alteration to external elevations, involving installation of windows to side elevation; provision of bin stores, cycle stores and private amenity space
